title: b'Publish new release to Pypi'
comments:
[b'Yeah we are also waiting \xf0\x9f\x98\x84', b'@snoopysecurity @Anon-Artist thanks for raising your request. Does nightly build solve your problem, we have nightly build but have not exposed to users. Or, in your scenario you need official release?', b'The vulnerability that the PR https://github.com/microsoft/nni/pull/3311 fixed was reported to Snyk Vulnerability disclosure program (https://snyk.io/vuln) We wanted to release an advisory crediting the reporter, as well as tell current users of `nni` to update to the latest version where this issue is fixed. So I mainly wanted a a pypi official release they could upgrade to (https://pypi.org/project/nni/#history) Am I right in thinking the nightly builds are not in pypi?

Also am I right to assume that Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) (https://msrc.microsoft.com/create-report) can assign a CVE to this issue?


', b'@snoopysecurity thanks, got the scenario. We will release a new version soon.', b'Any update @QuanluZhang  \xf0\x9f\x98\x8a', b'@Anon-Artist v2.1 will be released on March 8th.', b'> @Anon-Artist v2.1 will be released on March 8th.

Thats cool \xf0\x9f\x98\x8a', b'hi @QuanluZhang did the new version have released 
?
', b'@B3EF , will release today, after several hours. sorry for one day delay.', b'No issues @QuanluZhang \xf0\x9f\x98\x80
Hope you see this @snoopysecurity

On Wed, Mar 10, 2021, 12:24 PM QuanluZhang ***@***.***> wrote:

> @B3EF <https://github.com/B3EF> , will release today, after several
> hours. sorry for one day delay.
>
> \xe2\x80\x94
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/microsoft/nni/issues/3380#issuecomment-794983617>, or
> unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AOV66JRKZ3BVCERODT2MDHLTC4JQ7ANCNFSM4XQ543VQ>
> .
>
', b"Hi, yep, thanks for letting me know. I'll close this issue.", b'HI @QuanluZhang can we get a CVE id For this.', b'@QuanluZhang Snyk.io has recognized this vulnerability as https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PYTHON-NNI-1073630 so can we get a CVE for this.', b'@Anon-Artist @B3EF , sorry, I am not familiar with Snyk.io. could you give me some context about CVE and how to do it. maybe some links and guidance?', b'hi @snoopysecurity can you please explain  the criteria to be done to @QuanluZhang  ,to assign a CVE-id for us .', b"Hey, indeed I can help @QuanluZhang Snyk can't help with a CVE since its a microsoft product/software, Reading https://cve.mitre.org/cve/request_id.html, you should be able to assign a CVE by contacting `secure@microsoft.com` or directly MITRE through https://cveform.mitre.org/

All you need to do is contact one of the above authorities and provide the details, you can just copy and paste the details here https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PYTHON-NNI-1073630 (fixed version, github commit, vulnerability information etc etc) and they will assign a CVE for you.  Going through https://cveform.mitre.org/ is probably quicker. hope this helps", b'@qfyin @liuzhe-lz - Has the problem been solved? may we close the issue? thanks.', b'Yes sure the problem is fixed 
Thank you \xf0\x9f\x98\x8a', b'I will close this issue as the problem had been solved, feel free to reopen it.']
